place.name: SEARBY
place.gazetteerText: SEARBY-WITH-OWMBY, a parish in Caistor district, Lincoln; on the Wolds, 1½ mile E S E of Howsham r. station, and 4 N W by N of Caistor. Post-town, Brigg. Acres, 1,860. Real property, £3, 474. Pop., 263. Houses 51. The manor belongs to T. J. Dixon, Esq. The living is a double vicarage in the diocese of Lincoln. Value, £194.* Patrons, the Dean and Chapter of Bristol. The church was built in 1833. There are a Wesleyan chapel and a national school. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
